content: Which two capabilities are true for completion actions? Choose 2 answers
options: A. Completion actions are applied retroactively.
B. Completion actions do not execute on image file downloads
C. Completion actions cannot be applied directly on a landing page.
D. Completion actions apply to both visitors and prospects

title: Question 2

content:
A custom redirect has a completion action to add a tag of "clicked" to all prospects that click it. An unknown visitor clicks on the link and then fills out the form as Bob. A prospect also clicks on the link and fills out a form as Kate.
Which three things will affect the prospect records based on these activities? (Choose three answers.)
options: A. Bob's prospect record will show him clicking on the link and filling out the form.
B. Kate's prospect record will have a tag of "clicked" applied to it.
C. Bob's prospect record will have a tag of "clicked" applied to it.
D. Kate's prospect record will show her clicking on the link and filling out the form.
E. Bob's visitor record will have a tag of "clicked" applied to it.
title: Question 3

title: Question 6

content: What is needed for a page action to trigger for a prospect visiting a high value web page?
options: A. Adding a page action and Pardot tracking code on the page.
B. Adding a page action on the form.
C. Add a completion action on the landing page.
D. Create an automation rule based on the specific webpage.
title: Question 7

content:
LenoxSoft's marketing team shares a list of company names of all external visitors on their website with the regional sales managers. The regional managers use this list for cold calling and for insight on whether any recent opportunities are active on their site.
Which sequence of steps should the Pardot Administrator take to automate this process?
Choose one answer
options: A. Enable Visitors Filters for a specific IP range; Enable Page Actions to notify managers.
B. Enable Send daily prospect activity emails (for all prospects); Enable Page Actions to notify managers.
C. Enable Send daily visitor activity emails; Enable Send daily prospect activity emails (for my prospects).
D. Enable Visitor Filters for a specific IP range; Enable Send daily visitor activity emails.
title: Question 8

content: Which two actions can be used to change a prospect's Pardot campaign? (Choose two answers.)
options: A. Create a segmentation rule to change the Pardot campaign for prospects meeting certain criteria.
B. Manually change the prospect's Pardot campaign when editing the prospect record.
C. Add the prospect to a static list.
D. Create an automation rule to change Pardot campaign for prospects meeting certain criteria.
title: Question 9

content: What could cause standard sync actions from occurring?
options: A. Connector is not verified or has become unverified
B. Salesforce API limit has been reached
title: Question 10

content:
LenoxSoft has had a Product Interest form live on their website for the past 3 months. They would like to make sure that, moving forward, every time the form is submitted, a custom field is updated. They also want to update that custom field for anyone who has submitted the form before today.
What combination of automation tools should LenoxSoft use to achieve this?
Choose one answer
options: A. Dynamic list and automation rule
B. Completion action and dynamic list
C. Automation rule and completion action
D. Segmentation rule and completion action
title: Question 11

content: Jim, a sales manager, just converted a lead to a contact in Salesforce, but none of the lead's Pardot information (score/grade) transferred over. How do you address this issue?
options: A. Pardot only shows this information on the lead record.
B. The administrator needs to make sure he has mapped his lead fields to contact fields in Salesforce.
C. The administrator needs to create lookup fields on the contact to see this from the lead.
D. Once converted, this information shows on the account record and not the contact.
title: Question 12

content:
None of the above
Email, First Name, and Last Name are required fields in order for GoToWebinar to register a new user to an event.
title: Question 13
explanation:
Explanation
 When creating a Pardot form to register a prospect for a webinar, you must, at a minimum, include these three required fields to successfully register the prospect for a webinar.

B. The submission of the form retrieves and restores the previously deleted prospect information including activities.
C. A new prospect is created even though the prospect had previously been permanently deleted.
D. No new prospect is created because the prospect had previously been permanently deleted.

content: If a prospect clicks on a custom redirect after filling out a form, will the prospect's assigned Pardot campaign change?
options: A. Yes, but only if the Pardot completion action for the custom redirect is set to change the campaign.
B. No, a Pardot campaign will always stay the same since it's a first touchpoint.
C. Yes, the Pardot campaign will change based on the page the custom redirect links to.
D. No, it's not possible to change a Pardot campaign by clicking on a custom redirect.
title: Question 48
explanation:
Explanation
 D. Yes, the Pardot campaign will change based on the page the custom redirect links to.
 If you want to change a Prospect's Pardot Campaign, you can accomplish it via Automation Rules, Form completion actions, and more.

content: A client submits their Pardot form to test the form's completion actions. After they submit the form, none of the completion actions are applied to their prospect record. What explanation do you give as to why the actions did not occur?
options: A. The 'email' form field was set up to exclude free email addresses, so even though they submitted the form successfully, the Gmail address they used prevented the completion actions from running.
B. The client has a visitor filter set up to filter activities from their IP address. Completion actions do not occur on filtered visitors.
C. The client did not un-pause the completion actions.
D. Kiosk mode was enabled on the form, so completion actions did not run.
